title: Fahd of Saudi Arabia
summary: Fahd bin Abdulaziz Al Saud (Arabic: فهد بن عبد العزيز آل سعود‎ Fahd ibn ʿAbd al ʿAzīz Āl Suʿūd; 1921 or 1923 – 1 August 2005) was a Saudi Arabian politician who was King of Saudi Arabia from 13 June 1982 until his death in 2005. Prior to his ascension, he was Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia from 25 March 1975 to 13 June 1982. He was the eighth son of King Abdulaziz, the founder of modern Saudi Arabia. He was also the fourth of Abdulaziz's six sons who were kings (the others were Saud, Faisal, Khalid, Abdullah and Salman).
